identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Wide Pulse Pressure on the Predictability of Stroke Volume Variation for Fluid Responsiveness in Patients Undergoing Off-pump Coronary Artery Bypass Graft

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The investigators examined the predictability of stroke volume variation for fluid responsiveness in patients with wide pulse pressure undergoing off-pump coronary artery bypass graft

armGroups.label: Normal pulse pressure
interventionNames: Other: HES 130/0.4 (VoluvenⓇ, Fresenius Kabi, Graz, Austria) 500mL loading

armGroups.label: Wide pulse pressure
interventionNames: Other: HES 130/0.4 (VoluvenⓇ, Fresenius Kabi, Graz, Austria) 500mL loading

interventions.name: HES 130/0.4 (VoluvenⓇ, Fresenius Kabi, Graz, Austria) 500mL loading
interventions.description: HES 130/0.4 (VoluvenⓇ, Fresenius Kabi, Graz, Austria) 500mL loading during 15 minutes after induction of anesthesia

primaryOutcomes.measure: The predictability of stroke volume variation for fluid responsiveness in patients with wide pulse pressure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cut off value of stroke volume variation for predicting fluid responsiveness in patients with wide pulse pressure

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 1. Age ≥ 20
* 2. elective off-pump coronary artery bypass graft

Exclusion Criteria:

* 1. arrhythmia
* 2.EF \<40%
* 3.valvular heart dz
* 4.pul HTN
* 5.PAOD
* 6.lung dz
* 7.NYHA IV
* 8.ESRD

locations.facility: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine and Anesthesia and Pain Research Institute, Yonsei University College of Medicine
